articles.author: The Wall Street Journal
articles.title: China revokes press credentials of three Wall Street Journal reporters
articles.description: China has ordered Deputy Bureau Chief Josh Chin and reporter Chao Deng, both U.S. nationals, as well as reporter Philip Wen, an Australian national, have been to leave the country in five days.
articles.content:
China revoked the press credentials of three Wall Street Journal journalists based in Beijing, a rare expulsion of multiple reporters with the same international news organization at the same time.

articles.author: Doug Cameron , Andy Pasztor
articles.title: Debris found in fuel tanks of some undelivered Boeing 737 Max jets
articles.description: Boeing Co. said Tuesday that it had found debris in the fuel tanks of undelivered 737 Max jetliners, the latest setback in the plane maker’s efforts to address quality control problems.
articles.content:

articles.title: Passengers Disembark From Quarantined Diamond Princess Cruise Ship
articles.description: After a two-week quarantine, some passengers on the Diamond Princess cruise ship in Yokohama, Japan, have disembarked. Passengers who tested negative for coronavirus but shared cabins with infected patients have to remain on board. Photo: Kyodo/Reuters
